alert.note: Alert for Columbia (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 21 at 10:58AM CST until February 25 at 6:00AM CST by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Arkansas...Louisiana... Bayou Dorcheat Near Springhill affecting Columbia and Webster Parishes. For the Bayou Dorcheat...including Springhill, Dixie Inn, Lake Bistineau...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL SATURDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Bayou Dorcheat Near Springhill. * WHEN...Until Saturday morning. * IMPACTS...At 11.0 feet, Expect minor lowland flooding. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:00 AM CST Tuesday the stage was 11.7 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 10:00 AM CST Tuesday was 12.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage early Friday afternoon and continue falling to 10.5 feet Sunday morning. - Flood stage is 11.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 11.8 feet on 03/27/2017. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Do not drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. For more hydrologic information, copy and paste the following website address into your favorite web browser URL bar: water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=shv The next statement will be issued Wednesday morning at 1100 AM CST.
